result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Allen Vanderboom

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Allen Vanderboom appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Hauser appeared by video for David Allen Vanderboom.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Hauser is now the attorney of record.  Defense does not have discovery or an offer. Parties are requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 11-8-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 090932,
Payable Number: 1034355,
Receipt Number: 22RP038403,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant David Allen Vanderboom appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status of counsel.  Defendant informs the Court he hired private counsel but the attorney could not make it today. Case is adjourned to 10-11-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David Allen Vanderboom in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Defendant is requesting more time to hire a private attorney.  Case is adjourned to 9-12-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel by zoom.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CSP (10/15/1970) and HJP (2/1/1993).
No Weapons Order, signed and filed. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Remaining cash bail on deposit to be returned to the remitter. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant David Allen Vanderboom in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
